title: Saido Berahino tested positive for Class A party drug MDMA – found in ecstasy – leading to eight-week FA ban

locations.name: tianjin quanjian team news west brom

text:
Comments SAIDO BERAHINO tested positive for Class A party drug MDMA in September, SunSport can reveal. 
The striker tested positive for MDMA – the substance found in ecstasy tablets – at the routine test while at West Brom last year to lead to his eight-week FA ban. Reuters 8 Saido Berahino was suspended by the FA after failing a drugs test in September 
In his defence with the FA, Berahino explained his personal situation and the fact he had suffered depression due to weight issues and had also turned to drink. 
The forward is understood to have received help and advice from the West Brom and the FA. 
The striker received the suspension before his £15million move to Stoke last month for testing positive for recreational drug MDMA - which can be taken pure - in an out-of-competition test. Getty 8 MDMA can be taken pure or found in ecstasy tablets 
Berahino, who made his Stoke debut on Wednesday night, did not make a single appearance for West Brom between September 10 and his transfer to the Potters last week. 
And he also failed to appear for the Under-23 team for three months. 
Keep up to date with ALL the West Brom and Stoke City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club pages plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Baggies boss Tony Pulis admitted today that Berahino DID serve an eight-week suspension while at West Brom - but refused to discuss the matter further. 
But following Berahino's move last week, Pulis said the striker needed to "get his act together". 
The shock revelations will have no impact on his transfer to Stoke, who were made fully aware of the situation prior to the completion of the deal. 
The news has only just come to light because the FA have a policy of not making the names of those found guilty of doping offences that are not regulated by WADA public. News Group Newspapers Saido Berahino was videoed inhaling nitrous oxide in 2015 Sunday Mirror Saido Berahino has been snapped inhaling laughing gas, a legal high that a professional footballer should not be touching Reuters Berahino moved to Stoke in the January transfer window Stoke 1-1 Everton : Peter Crouch scores his 100th Premier League goal 
A positive test for recreational drugs outside of competition is not considered a breach of World Anti-Doping Agency Code. 
But the FA does enforce suspensions for fear over players' health and the image of the English game if they are caught using recreational drugs such as cannabis and cocaine. 
Two months ago, which would be during the time he was suspended, he told West Brom's website: "This last year has been the most difficult of my career and it has left me short of the form and fitness required for the Premier League.
